# Recipe: Crockpot Chili Con Carne

## Table of Contents
- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Ingredients](#ingredients)
- [Equipment](#equipment)

- [Cooking Time](#cooking-time)
- [Steps](#steps)
- [Serving Suggestions](#serving-suggestions)
- [Variations](#variations)
- [Tips and Tricks](#tips-and-tricks)
- [Nutritional Information](#nutritional-information)
- [Storage and Leftovers](#storage-and-leftovers)
- [Frequently Asked Questions](#frequently-asked-questions)

## Introduction
Crockpot Chili Con Carne is a hearty and flavorful Tex-Mex dish that combines tender chunks of beef, beans, and spices. This slow-cooked chili is perfect for chilly nights and gatherings with friends and family. The long cooking time allows the flavors to meld together, resulting in a rich and satisfying dish.

## Ingredients
- 1.5 pounds (680g) beef stew meat, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1 onion, diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 can (14.5 ounces) diced tomatoes
- 1 can (15 ounces) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 can (15 ounces) black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 can (6 ounces) tomato paste
- 2 cups beef broth
- 2 tablespoons chili powder
- 1 tablespoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon oregano
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- Optional toppings: shredded cheese, sour cream, diced avocado, chopped cilantro

## Equipment
- Crockpot or slow cooker
- Cutting board
- Knife
- Can opener
- Wooden spoon or spatula

## Preparation Time
- 15 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 6-8 hours on low heat or 4-6 hours on high heat

## Steps
1. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the beef stew meat and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the meat from the skillet and set aside.
2. In the same skillet, add the diced onion, minced garlic, and diced red bell pepper. Cook until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Transfer the cooked vegetables to the crockpot or slow cooker.
4. Add the browned beef stew meat, diced tomatoes, kidney beans, black beans, tomato paste, beef broth, chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, and pepper to the crockpot or slow cooker. Stir well to combine all the ingredients.
5. Cover the crockpot or slow cooker and cook on low heat for 6-8 hours or on high heat for 4-6 hours, until the beef is tender and the flavors have melded together.
6. Taste and adjust the seasonings if needed.
7. Serve the chili con carne hot, garnished with your choice of optional toppings such as shredded cheese, sour cream, diced avocado, and chopped cilantro.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the crockpot chili con carne with a side of warm cornbread or tortilla chips.
- It pairs well with a fresh green salad or a side of steamed vegetables.

## Variations
- For a spicier kick, add a diced jalapeno or a pinch of cayenne pepper to the chili.
- Experiment with different types of beans such as pinto beans or white beans.
- Add diced bell peppers of different colors for a vibrant and visually appealing chili.

## Tips and Tricks
- Browning the beef stew meat before adding it to the crockpot adds extra flavor to the chili.
- If you prefer a thicker chili, mix 1 tablespoon of cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of water and stir it into the chili during the last 30 minutes of cooking.
- Leftover chili con carne can be frozen in airtight containers for up to 3 months.

## Nutritional Information
- *Note: Nutritional information may vary depending on the specific ingredients used.*

- Calories: 350
- Fat: 12g
- Protein: 30g
- Carbohydrates: 30g
- Fiber: 8g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftover chili con carne in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.
- Reheat the chili on the stovetop or in the microwave until heated through before serving.

## Frequently Asked Questions
- **Can I use ground beef instead of beef stew meat?**
  - Yes, you can use ground beef instead. Brown the ground beef in a skillet before adding it to the crockpot.

- **Can I make this chili vegetarian?**
  - Absolutely! Simply omit the beef stew meat and replace it with additional beans or diced vegetables of your choice. Increase the amount of vegetable broth to compensate for the missing beef broth.

- **Can I make this chili spicier?**
  - Yes, you can adjust the level of spiciness by adding more chili powder, cayenne pepper, or diced jalapenos.

- **Can I freeze the leftovers?**
  - Yes, you can freeze the leftover chili con carne in airtight containers for up to 3 months. Thaw it in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.
